Set a folder containing the Prettier mod: Set a folder containing the Prettier module. If unset, the extension first tries to resolve a workspace-specific installation, or uses the bundled module if 'Prefer Bundled Prettier' is enabled. If neither is available, the bundled module will be used as a fallback.
Use the bundled Prettier module and plug: Use the bundled Prettier module and plugins instead of resolving from the workspace. This is ignored if a custom Prettier module path is set.
Set a path to a custom Prettier configur:
Set a path to a custom Prettier configuration file. If unset, the extension will attempt to resolve one from the workspace or fall back to its own configuration.

Only files with JSON syntax are supported.
Ignore all configuration files and alway: Ignore all configuration files and always use the extension's configuration. This is ignored if a custom Prettier configuration file is set.
Send debug information to the Extension: Send debug information to the Extension Console.
Used for remote files, when no configura: Used for remote files, when no configuration file is found, or when configuration files are ignored.
Specify the line length that the printer: Specify the line length that the printer will wrap on.
Specify the number of spaces per indenta: Specify the number of spaces per indentation-level.
Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces: Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces.
Print semicolons at the ends of statemen: Print semicolons at the ends of statements.
Use single quotes instead of double quot: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.
Change when properties in objects are qu: Change when properties in objects are quoted.
Use single quotes instead of double quot: Use single quotes instead of double quotes in JSX.
Print trailing commas wherever possible: Print trailing commas wherever possible in multi-line comma-separated syntactic structures. (A single-line array, for example, never gets trailing commas.)
Print spaces between brackets in object: Print spaces between brackets in object literals.
Configure how Prettier wraps object lite: Configure how Prettier wraps object literals when they could fit on one line or span multiple lines.
Put the > of a multi-line HTML (HTML, JS: Put the > of a multi-line HTML (HTML, JSX, Vue, Angular) element at the end of the last line instead of being alone on the next line (does not apply to self closing elements).
Include parentheses around a sole arrow: Include parentheses around a sole arrow function parameter.
Prettier can restrict itself to only for: Prettier can restrict itself to only format files that contain a special comment, called a pragma, at the top of the file. This is very useful when gradually transitioning large, unformatted codebases to Prettier.
Prettier can insert a special @format ma: Prettier can insert a special @format marker at the top of files specifying that the file has been formatted with Prettier. This works well when used in tandem with the above Require Pragma option. If there is already a docblock at the top of the file then this option will add a newline to it with the @format marker.
By default, Prettier will not change wra: By default, Prettier will not change wrapping in markdown text since some services use a linebreak-sensitive renderer, e.g. GitHub comments and BitBucket. To have Prettier wrap prose to the print width, change this option to "always". If you want Prettier to force all prose blocks to be on a single line and rely on editor/viewer soft wrapping instead, you can use "never".
Specify the global whitespace sensitivit: Specify the global whitespace sensitivity for HTML, Vue, Angular, and Handlebars. See Prettier documentation for more info.
Vue files script and style tags indentat: Vue files script and style tags indentation
Whether or not to indent the code inside: Whether or not to indent the code inside <script> and <style> tags in Vue files.
Control whether Prettier formats quoted: Control whether Prettier formats quoted code embedded in the file.
Enforce single attribute per line in HTM: Enforce single attribute per line in HTML, Vue, and JSX.
Select whether to use global settings, e: Select whether to use global settings, enable, or disable the plugin.
Allows specifying the PHP version you're: Allows specifying the PHP version you're using. If you're using PHP 7.1 or later, setting this option will make use of modern language features in the printed output. If you're using PHP lower than 7.0, you'll have to set this option or Prettier will generate incompatible code.
If set to true, trailing commas will be: If set to true, trailing commas will be added wherever possible. If set to false, no trailing commas are printed.
If set to 'per-cs', prettier will move o: If set to 'per-cs', prettier will move open brace for code blocks (classes, functions and methods) onto new line. If set to '1tbs', prettier will move open brace for code blocks (classes, functions and methods) onto same line.
Adds a space before self-closing tags.
Orders XML attributes by key alphabetica: Orders XML attributes by key alphabetically while prioritizing xmlns attributes.
You may want 'ignore' or 'preserve', see: You may want 'ignore' or 'preserve', see the info.
Specifies the formatter to use for SQL c: Specifies the formatter to use for SQL code formatting.
Specifies the SQL dialect to use.
Newline before or after boolean operator: Newline before or after boolean operator (AND, OR, XOR).
Maximum number of characters in parenthe: Maximum number of characters in parenthesized expressions to be kept on single line.
How many newlines to insert between quer: How many newlines to insert between queries.
Specifies parameter values to fill in fo: Specifies parameter values to fill in for placeholders inside SQL.
Specifies parameter types to support whe: Specifies parameter types to support when parsing SQL prepared statements.
Specifies whether to focus on tables or: Specifies whether to focus on tables or columns for parsing and formatting in SQL queries.
Escape with \\u all non-Latin-1 characte: Escape with \u all non-Latin-1 characters, to allow safely encoding output as ISO-8859-1.
Set the separator to use between a prope: Set the separator to use between a property key and its value.
NGINX configuration files formatter plug: NGINX configuration files formatter plugin for Prettier
Align directive parameters within a bloc: Align directive parameters within a block to the same column.
Align all directive parameters within a: Align all directive parameters within a file to the same column.
Wrap parameters to new lines to fit prin: Wrap parameters to new lines to fit print width.
Automatically format documents when they: Automatically format documents when they are saved.
When enabled, documents without a Pretti: When enabled, documents without a Prettier configuration file will not be formatted on save.
When enabled, remote documents will be i: When enabled, remote documents will be ignored during format on save.
Documents that are set to an ignored syn: Documents that are set to an ignored syntax will not be formatted when saved.
Prettier integration for Nova — format J: Prettier integration for Nova — format JavaScript, TypeScript, JSON, CSS, HTML, Markdown, and more, with built-in support for Java, PHP, SQL, and XML — no extra setup required.
